body:
Hello guys Passively here and today I need your help because I'm really stressed with my Minecraft problem so let me explain what is happening.

Well, I upgraded my computer to Windows 10 Pro because I was having some RAM issues in the old Windows 7 (I couldn't allocate more RAM to my Minecraft) but that's not the point. Everything was working perfectly in the first weekend with the new Windows 10 but the problem arrived a few weeks ago.
When I leave the Minecraft inactive and look for something on the Internet, when I open again the Minecraft, appears 2 white boxes saying that the Minecraft isn't responding, everything is frozen and I can't do anything. But when it happens like 10 times in a row, the sensibility of my Minecraft is uncontrollable, for example, if I move the screen (moving the head) the FPS fall to 5-10, but if I press the right click, the sensitivity becomes normal, and I need to turn off my PC and wait like an hour to fix temporary the problem.

I honestly don't know how to fix this problem, I deleted my .minecraft folder, I reinstalled Java (the newest version), I tried some old solutions in some Minecraft Forums and none of them worked, I reinstalled Minecraft (Java version and .exe version) and I'm really tired of this problem.





PC Specs:
  • Processor: AMD Anthlon(tm) II X4 640 Processor 3.00GHz
  • RAM: 8.00 GB (2x4GB)
  • Windows Version: Windows 10 Pro
  • Graphics Card: NVIDIA GT420 128bit, 2GB DDR3
  • Motherboard: ASRock N68C-GS4FXK
  • Java Version: Java: 1.8.0_25 64Bit
If someone can help with this it would be amazing, please :(

replies.body:
I fixed the problem, thanks to Diamond22 for telling me the solution. If you have any problem with this you can come here and see how to fix it. There you go the solution:

"ok, sounds like driver issues with windows 10. use http://www.guru3d.com/files-details/display-driver-uninstaller-download.html to remove your current graphics drivers, follow its instructions"

"once it is uninstalled, open windows update and check for updates, it will download and install the latest driver"
